SENT.plain: A 63-year-old man was seen with a history of nonfluent dysphasia and headaches
His blood tested positive for anticardiolipin antibodies
Transthoracic echocardiography showed a mass in the left ventricular apex
The transgastric five-chamber view identified this mass as an anomalously placed papillary muscle

In the presence of an apical mass, if the transthoracic echocardiogram is equivocal, a transesophageal echocardiogram, using the transgastric five-chamber view may be helpful in making the correct diagnosis
